citations.narrative:
The licensee is not retaining copies of medical records for puppies after disposition. The licensee creates vaccine and de-
worming records, however, once the puppy is sold, the document goes to the buyer and the information is not retained
elsewhere at the facility. Not retaining information related to medical care for the puppies prohibits the APHIS inspector
from ensuring the licensee is appropriately following the Program of Vet Care for vaccination and de-worming
administration and also prohibits them from ensuring the licensee is providing adequate veterinary care to the puppies.
Records are required to be kept and maintained for 1 year after an animal is disposed of (sold), unless there is express
written consent by the Administrator. Correct by: August 1, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
